definition: to enlist/to draft/to conscript/to appoint to an official position
4th note in pentatonic scale 五音[wu3 yin1], roughly sol/see also 徵|征[zheng1]
to invite/to recruit/to levy (taxes)/to draft (troops)/phenomenon/symptom/characteristic sign (used as proof)/evidence
surname Shao/name of an ancient state that existed in what is now Shaanxi Province
to call together/to summon/to convene/temple or monastery (used in place names in Inner Mongolia)

sentences.english: They were called up at the age of nineteen.
sentences.chinese: 他們十九歲時被徵召入伍。

sentences.english: A mini-submarine was called in to help the search for bodies, along with divers.
sentences.chinese: 一艘微型潛艇被徵召，以配合潛水員搜索屍體。

sentences.english: Levy Spearmen are common folk from villages and towns that have been levied into the army.
sentences.chinese: 徵召矛兵通常來自於村鎮平民，被徵召入伍參加戰鬥。

sentences.english: Levy Spearmen are common folk from villages and towns that have been levied into the army.
sentences.chinese: 徵召矛兵通常來自於村鎮平民，被徵召入伍參加戰鬥。

sentences.english: He was called up for Brazil's under-20 team for the first time in June.
sentences.chinese: 在六月份他首次被徵召入巴西20歲以下國家隊。

sentences.english: Even many young students were conscripted into the army.
sentences.chinese: 甚至很多年輕的學生也被徵召到陸軍中服兵役。

sentences.english: The surprise was Montoya, how did he react when he heard he was called?
sentences.chinese: 蒙託亞被徵召是個驚喜，當時他是什麼反應？

sentences.english: To recruit is to re-grow the army.
sentences.chinese: 徵召新兵就是重新使軍力成長的意思。

sentences.english: When the war broke out, they were at once called up.
sentences.chinese: 戰爭一爆發，他們立即就被徵召入伍了。

sentences.english: Sergeant Spearmen are professional warriors, drawn from the lower classes.
sentences.chinese: 長矛軍士爲職業部隊，從社會低等級中徵召。

sentences.english: He was drafted by the army and served for 4 years.
sentences.chinese: 他被徵召入伍，在部隊裏服役了4年。

sentences.english: "I will choose whichever nation calls me up first, " Amauri explained.
sentences.chinese: “我會選擇首先徵召我的那支球隊，”阿毛裏解釋道。

sentences.english: The nation levied all able-bodied man for the war.
sentences.chinese: 國家徵召所有壯丁參戰。

sentences.english: He answered the call to army.
If the war break out, the youth will be called up at once.
sentences.chinese: 假如戰爭爆發，年輕人將立刻被徵召入伍。

definition: to muster troops/(fig.) to gather forces
sporting coach/military drill master (in Song times)
Ling county in Dezhou 德州[De2 zhou1], Shandong
to ride to take up an official appointment (idiom); to take on a job with alacrity/to undertake a task
to fire/to sack/to dismiss/to terminate employment
